Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the visa officer committed a reviewable error by failing to consider all evidence and incorrectly applying the law
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA) and Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations (IRPR)
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicant's explanation for applying as 'kitchen helper' was not properly assessed
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Application documents, explanation of job title change, intent to leave Canada
Crimes.Legal_Provision: IRPA and IRPR requirements for temporary entry and assessment of intent
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Unreasonable decision due to failure to consider relevant evidence
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Visa officer's negative inference regarding potential permanent residence intent
Crimes.Regulation_Cited: IRPR sections related to temporary resident entry
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to consider applicant's explanation for job title change
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Assessment of genuineness as a temporary resident
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: Applicant's explanation for reapplying under 'kitchen helper'
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Standard of reasonableness in administrative decision-making
Crimes.Application_Factor: Change in occupation title from 'cook' to 'kitchen helper'
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Misapplication of law and failure to consider evidence
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA and IRPR provisions on temporary residence and dual intent
Crimes.Outcome_of_Review: Case remitted for redetermination by new visa officer
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Perceived lack of genuineness as a temporary worker
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to consider applicant's explanation for role change
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Violation due to inadequate consideration of evidence
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Negative credibility inference based on potential PR intent
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Failure to conduct proper evidentiary assessment
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Misrepresentation concerns due to perceived intent inconsistency

Crimes.Crime_Name: Work Permit Refusal under Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the visa officer committed a reviewable error by failing to consider all evidence and misapplying the law
Crimes.Governing_Law: Subsection 200(1) of IRPR and subsection 22(2) of IRPA
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Judicial review of work permit refusal
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicant's stated intent to transition from kitchen helper to cook not adequately considered
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Occupational background, future career plans, potential permanent residence intent
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Unreasonable decision due to misapplication of law and ignored evidence
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Incorrect adverse inference from potential permanent residence application
Crimes.Application_Error: Misinterpretation of dual intent provisions under IRPA
Crimes.Review_Outcome: Decision set aside and case remitted
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: Applicant's intention to develop skills toward becoming a cook
Crimes.Application_Factor: Potential for future permanent residence application
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Failure to apply dual intent rule correctly
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Subsection 22(2) IRPA (dual intent), Subsection 200(1) IRPR (temporary stay requirement)
Crimes.Outcome_of_Review: Remanded for reconsideration by new officer
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Perceived lack of genuineness as a temporary worker
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to consider applicantâ€™s career development plan
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Decision lacked fairness due to incomplete analysis
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Doubt cast on temporary intent based on future PR possibility
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Argument that dual intent was legally permissible
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to recognize lawful dual intent
